title: Phase Definition Checklist
content:
For each phase in your DDP, verify:

- [ ] Phase has a clear, descriptive name
- [ ] Owner/responsible person is assigned
- [ ] Start and end dates are defined
- [ ] Entry criteria are specified
- [ ] Exit criteria are specified
- [ ] Deliverables are listed
- [ ] Dependencies on other phases are documented
- [ ] Required resources are identified
- [ ] Quality gates are defined
- [ ] Status tracking method is specified

title: Pre-Development Readiness
content:
Before starting development, ensure:

- [ ] Requirements are reviewed and approved
- [ ] Architecture design is complete
- [ ] Tech stack decisions are finalized
- [ ] Development environment is set up
- [ ] CI/CD pipeline is configured
- [ ] Code repository and branching strategy defined
- [ ] Team roles and responsibilities are clear
- [ ] Communication channels established
- [ ] Risk register is in place
- [ ] Initial backlog is prioritized

title: Deployment Readiness
content:
Before deployment, verify:

- [ ] All tests pass (unit, integration, e2e)
- [ ] Performance testing completed
- [ ] Security review completed
- [ ] Documentation is up-to-date
- [ ] Runbooks are prepared
- [ ] Rollback procedure is documented
- [ ] Monitoring and alerting configured
- [ ] Stakeholders are notified
- [ ] Support team is briefed
- [ ] Post-deployment validation plan exists
